fields.name: Accordion
fields.instructions: Accordion Block - please specify a title

fields.name: Accordion Wrapper
fields.instructions: Wrapper of a group of Accordions.

fields.name: Anchor
fields.instructions: Anchor name - no special characters and can not start with a number

new1.name: Positionsfix
new1.instructions: If the anchor is too high or too low, the position value can be adjusted (higher or lower).

fields.name: Button
fields.instructions: Button for linking internal and external content

new2.name: Full Width
new2.instructions: If the button centered has been created, you can also give it the full width.

new3.name: Position
new3.instructions: The buttons are arranged left-aligned, can be overwritten.

fields.name: Card
fields.instructions: Text Box with Media Assets

new1.name: Image
new1.instructions: A picture will be integrated in any case. If a video is used, the picture serves as a fallback.

new2.name: Media Ratio
new2.instructions: Aspect ratio of the image

fields.name: Card Slider
fields.instructions: A slider module for cards

new2.name: Setup
new2.instructions: Select one of the existing setups or define a new one under `Categories> Settings: Image Slider`

fields.name: Comment Switch
fields.instructions: To disable comments

fields.name: Copyright
fields.instructions: Copyright Message

fields.name: Disqus Name
fields.instructions: Name of your disqus account

fields.name: Embed Content
fields.instructions: To include external content such as videos, code snippets, or maps

new1.name: Embed URL
new1.instructions: If it is a video of Youtube, Vimeo or Facebook, you can copy the URL into the field

new2.name: Embed Code
new2.instructions: Insert the corresponding IFrame code here. If the URL field is filled, the code is ignored.

new2.name: Responsive
new2.instructions: Do you want to display the content responsive?

fields.name: Featured Image
fields.instructions: Image of the respective posts - is used for surveys, headers, SEO and OG tags

new1.name: Fullbleed
new1.instructions: Should the image be spread over the entire browser width?

new2.name: Ratio
new2.instructions: Image Ratio

fields.name: Gallery
fields.instructions: Gallery module with Lightbox Support and two layout types

new2.name: Caption
new2.instructions: Optional caption is only visible in the lightbox.

new1.name: Layout Typ
new1.instructions: Smart for a thumbnail layout in Tumbler Styles (Photogrid), Simple for simple thumbnail matching

new2.name: Ratio
new2.instructions: Image ratio of the thumbnails for the `simple layout` mode. Format '1:1'

new3.name: Width
new3.instructions: Thumbnail width for the Simple Layout. Regularly, the width of thumbnails depends on the number of images per row. If this is too big or too small, you can set the width yourself.

fields.name: Generic
fields.instructions: With the content field you can embed generic content, such as a news archive, into the content.

new2.name: Ratio
new2.instructions: Ratio of the background image

new3.name: Position
new3.instructions: Background Position of the image (css syntax)

new4.name: Adapt Container
new4.instructions: Do you want the background container to be as broad as the content container?

new5.name: Width
new5.instructions: Width of the background image - default always full width

new1.name: Box Name
new1.instructions: Add the box name, either the area name or the class's child name.

new2.name: Styling
new2.instructions: Here you can write down several CSS classes for separate styling

new1.name: Anchor
new1.instructions: Name of the optional jump anchor

new2.name: Styling
new2.instructions: Here you can select additional styling classes.

new3.name: Setup Choice
new3.instructions: Select one of the existing grid setups

new4.name: Inner Container
new4.instructions: Inside the wrapper another container will be inserted which will contain the grid. You can determine how wide this container will be.

typesettings.json:
{ "value":"default" , "label":"Page width", "default":true },
{ "value":"full" , "label":"Full wrapper width" },
{ "value":"bigger-25" , "label":"25% over page width" },
{ "value":"bigger-45" , "label":"45% over page width" },
{ "value":"smaller-25" , "label":"25% less than side width" },
{ "value":"smaller-50" , "label":"50% less than side width" }

fields.name: Grid Setup
fields.instructions: CSS styling of the grid

new2.name: Grid Class Name
new2.instructions: Class name of the grid used as prefix for the child elements.

new4.name: IE11 compatible
new4.instructions: IE10 to Edge 15 can only handle the first revision of the CSS grid layout, if you need to support these browsers you have to enable this option. The name in the boxes then becomes the class name.

new5.name: Inlined Style
new5.instructions: Activate the option if you want to use inline styles

new6.name: Style
new6.instructions: Inline style of the grid, can be described with mediaqueries and the inner child elements.

fields.name: Grid Wrapper
fields.instructions: Sections variant, is able to carry multiple boxes and position them using CSS grid layout.

fields.name: Headline Option
fields.instructions: Size of the headline, the regular headline has a semantic size of a H2. The override controller can be used to readjust the size independent of its semantics.

fields.name: Hero
fields.instructions: Hero Image for Homepages

fields.name: Image Slider
fields.instructions: Slider Modul

fields.name: Image Slider Options
fields.instructions: The ratio applies to all images, Craft will crops the pictures so they fit into the format (Default is 16:10). The Caption is optional and applies to the entire slider.

new2.name: Setup
new2.instructions: Select one of the existing setups or define a new one under `Categories> Settings: Image Slider`

fields.name: Instagram
fields.instructions: Integrate Instagram Images

new2.name: Size
new2.instructions: Retrieval size of the image

new3.name: Linkable
new3.instructions: Should the image be linked to the original post?

new5.name: Position
new5.instructions: CSS background position of the image, is only relevant if you have used a ratio

fields.name: Jumpnavigation
fields.instructions: Buttons for jump navigations

new2.name: Anchor
new2.instructions: Name of the anchor without # (and no other no special character)

new2.name: Layout
new2.instructions: The default layout is a simple left-aligned string of the links, with the full width, the buttons are arranged in the full width (break at too small size but around which the buttons are interrelated). The buttons are arranged like a list.

new2.name: Typ
new2.instructions: Listtype

new3.name: Bullet
new3.instructions: Style of Bullets on unsorted lists

fields.name: Markdown
fields.instructions: For contents in the Markdown format (http://markdown.de/)

fields.name: Markdown Options
fields.instructions: Markdown Optionen

new2.name: Add Anchor
new2.instructions: Should the headings h1 - h3 be equipped with an anchor?

fields.name: Media Image
fields.instructions: This image takes the full content width and can be provided with a caption.

new2.name: Ratio
new2.instructions: Size ratio of the image

new3.name: Hight Restriction
new3.instructions: If it is a picture in the portrait format, it can be that it is longer than the viewport is high. The height limit limits the height to maximum viewport height - you no longer have to scroll around the entire image.

fields.name: Quote
fields.instructions: For quote blocks with Author

fields.name: Section Column
fields.instructions: Column in a section

fields.name: Section Column Options
fields.instructions: Spalte in einer Sektion

new1.name: Styling
new1.instructions: Here you can select additional styling classes.

fields.name: Section Layout
fields.instructions: Weighting of individual columns.

new2.name: Three Columns
new2.instructions: Width ratio for three columns

new1.name: Anchor
new1.instructions: Optional anchor for jump navigation without # (and without special characters)

fields.name: Section Wrapper
fields.instructions: Subsegment of a content module, when the page wrapper is removed the section can run over the full browser width.

fields.name: Slideout Box
fields.instructions: A content box that expands by click - intended to hide the user rather irrelevant content.

new1.name: Trigger
new1.instructions: Activation link to open the box

new2.name: Animation Speed
new2.instructions: Setting the animation speed

new6.name: Autoheight
new6.instructions: With Autoheight, the height of each Slides is Dynamic

new2.name: Slides per View
new2.instructions: Number of visible slides

new5.name: Freescroll
new5.instructions: With Freescroll, the slider can be moved freely

new6.name: Responsive
new6.instructions: If multiple slides are displayed at the same time, you can reduce the number of columns by using Responsive with smaller viewport.

fields.name: Social Networks
fields.instructions: Links to the social networks

fields.name: Spacer
fields.instructions: Element to expand the distance. A spacer is 20px

fields.name: Tab
fields.instructions: The individual tab, please enter the title of the tab

fields.name: Tab Wrapper
fields.instructions: Wrapper of the Tab group
